body.name: Pampers Splashers Swim Diapers - Size S, 20 Count, Gap-Free Disposable Baby Swim Pants
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 14 hrs 52 mins
features: Pampers Splashers disposable swim diapers for toddlers are designed for water fun at the pool, beach, splash park, and more
Doesn't swell in water like regular diapers, for a comfortable fit when wet or dry
Dual Leak-Guard Barriers fit snug around your little swimmer's legs to help contain messes
360° stretchy waistband provides an all-around stretchy fit that fits like swimwear
Easy-Tear Sides are designed to make removal quick and easy
Swim-inspired, all-over graphics for a design that looks like swimwear
body.description: Your baby is free to make a splash in Pampers Splashers disposable swim diapers! Pampers Splashers don’t swell in water like regular diapers, giving your baby a comfortable fit when wet or dry. For secure protection in the water, Splashers Dual-LeakGuard BarriersTM fit snug around your baby’s legs to help contain messes, making them perfect for the pool, beach, splash park, and more. Only Pampers Splashers are designed with a 360° all-around stretchy waistband that fits like swimwear and easily pulls on and off—even when wet. Plus, Splashers are equipped with Easy-Tear Sides for a quick disposal with less mess, and our adorable, swim-inspired, all-over graphics look like real swimwear. Pampers Splashers make a day at the pool even more fun.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Active Baby Fit The correct size swim pant for your baby should conform to their body and allow them to move freely, while keeping its shape at the waist and between the legs. Find the Right Fit Start by using this chart to find the right fit for your baby. Babies come in all shapes and sizes. That’s why Splashers has multiple sizes and a stretchy waistband to fit every baby. Wearing and Changing Splashers are designed to be worn alone or under your baby’s favorite swimsuit. Easy-Tear Sides make it simple to remove when they need a change or are finished playing in the water.

Our Commitment Caring for babies is in our DNA. Our Pampers Bright Beginnings programs enable healthy development and early success for babies and families through education, hospital partnerships, and donations March of Dimes Partnership Pampers is proud to support the March of Dimes in giving every baby a fighting chance. We help provide our smallest diapers to the 1 million babies born before 28-week gestational age each year Sustainability Pampers cares for every baby and the planet they grow up in. We maintain zero manufacturing to landfill across all our plants and are committed to 100% renewable electricity by 2030 Community Donations Through ongoing donation efforts and partnerships with organizations like Feeding America and Matthew 25, Pampers strives to help babies get the bright beginnings they deserve Changing Table Access 9 out of 10 dads have used a public restroom that lacks a changing table. As part of our “Love the Change” campaign, we’re providing 5,000 changing tables for men’s restrooms across North America Hospital Support Proud to be the #1 choice of U.S. hospitals for nearly 50 years, we partner with nurses to develop skin-protecting products and support nursing education—all to help baby’s healthy development

Are these swim diapers safe for the beach? Yes! Splashers are perfect for the beach, pool or any water activity. Unlike regular diapers, Splashers don’t swell in water and have a 360° Gap-Free Fit waistband and Dual Leak-Guard Barriers to protect during play. How do you properly remove the diapers? To remove, just rip the Easy-Tear Sides and roll up the diaper to dispose. Are Splashers safe for my baby’s skin? Yes! Babies' health and safety are our priority at Pampers. To keep your baby’s skin healthy, Splashers are hypoallergenic—free of elemental chlorine bleaching, parabens and latex. Are Splashers designed for boys or girls? Splashers are designed to be gender-neutral for both boys and girls to use. They also feature swimwear-style graphics with cute beach characters. How far in advance of swimming should I put these on my baby? Because the diapers are specially designed to contain a mess while swimming and not be big and bulky like a traditional diaper, you will have the best experience if you put these on right before your child is ready to go swimming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gets bigger when wet! SIZE DOWN! 🏊🏼‍♂️
reviews.reviewText: Sorry for the long review!! I had a hard time figuring out what size to order, so I hope this helps someone.....In short: these are great swim diapers that work better when they fit snugly. The style is very similar to Pampers 360s; the sides are the same and rip easily at the seams when you need to remove them, but they’re a little more fitted and not as tall in the waistband. They have the same coverage as 360s in the back. I had no idea what size to order, since my kiddo normally wears a larger size than the suggested weight guides on the box.For size reference: he’s almost 2, about 29 lbs & wears 3T clothing. In diapers, he wears size 6 Pampers 360s, and size 7 Huggies Little Movers. First I ordered Large, and after a week of wearing those, we sized down and ordered Medium.Size Large fits exactly how I like his regulars diapers to fit, but in water they get really water-logged and start slipping down too much (hello, baby plumber butt 🍑). It’s better when a swim diaper fits snugly, so the Mediums are perfect. They aren’t too tight in the leg openings and don’t leave any red marks...Compared to Huggies Little Swimmers, these are way softer and don’t have scratchy velcro sides. I think these are much easier to pull up, especially when your little one is wet or has sunscreen on. Huggies look more like pull-ups and these fit more like a slip-on diaper.I’m happy to report these work perfectly and don’t fall apart, even after wearing one for 2+ hours in the pool. If you’re unsure what size to get, SIZE DOWN from what you think you need. They stretch a lot, but if they’re too big you’ll be squeezing buckets full of water (or pee) out of them.Not the BEST diaper to use for regular wear or when dry. They don’t absorb urine, so it just collects & pours out. Haven’t had any #2 accidents in the water yet, but i don’t expect to see any escapees.I highly recommend them!*MOM HACK: Since these aren’t great for holding pee when dry, I found a great solution when you have to drive to a pool or beach. Simply put a regular diaper on first, but don’t tape it shut. Layer one of these over it. Dress as usual. When you get to the water, simply pull the regular diaper out! Voila!! Otherwise, if you putting this on or a 20 min car ride by itself, you’ll have a VERY wet car seat.Hope this helps! Happy swimmin’! 💦

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I used these with my son 6 years ago, and am using them again with my 9 month old.They don’t absorb too much of the swimming water and seem to get a lot of the urine to absorb. But the biggest concern of any parent with a non potty trained child in a swimming pool is not pee, it’s the #2. This keeps it in! It’s happened several times while they’re wearing these and Nothing comes out. It stays in so we’ll, sometimes we didn’t even know it had happened.The washable baby swim diapers work well too, but I stopped using them after the first time a #2 happened, because no one wants to clean that up and wash the diaper to use again. It’s not worth the hassle.These are easy, dependable and not too $$. They are the only disposable swim diapers that I really trust.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps poop isolated
reviews.reviewText: My 2 yr old made the biggest dump in these during swim lessons in a pool on at least 2 occasions and nothing came out of the diaper thankfully. However, the poop covered the entire inside from front to back when we finally took them off, so thankfully we were prepared with wipes to clean him down.The diapers will not absorb much liquid so if your kid pees in them it will leak out. These are really to catch poo.A few pro tips:- you can tell which is the front by checking for a little bow “tied” or laces (depending on the design) in the front waist.- to get them off, just tear the sides of the diaper open instead of pulling them down*I purchased this product with my own money and my review reflects my honest and unbiased opinion. I hope you find it helpful. Thanks for reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars moves well with baby
reviews.reviewText: Fits well for size listed, my baby is around 25% percentile and the legs have had no leaks. She is able to run and play and swim like normal and I like how easy they tear off when you are ready to be done. Have had no issues with the side panels tearing just during swimming or splash pad times.
Son buenísimos, no se inflan, aguantan súper bien y se ven bonitos
Fit well and work well. Used them for our trip to Mexico. And never had an accident
Ligeros, excelente calidad. Y talla súper

Los compré por este medio ya que los busque en tiendas de autoservicio, departamentales y algunas farmacias son éxito, algunos los manejan pero no de esta medida que son de los más grandes, en mi caso era para una niña de 3 años pero con medidas de una niña de 4 (con poco más de 15kg) jejeje, así que era la talla más grande que puede encontrar y se adecuó a mi nena perfectamente. Ojo no esperes ese material absorbente como el de un pañal regular, es decir si lo trae pero en menos escala, yo diría 1/3 del absorbente que trae un pañal regular, y cuando lo vas a retirar procura hacerlo en un lugar donde puedas acostar a tu bebé, porque si lo retiras de pie estoy seguro que se puede escurrir, recuerda que este pañal es para evitar que su interior salga a la alberca, lo cual cumplirá perfectamente ya que sus resortes se ajustarán perfectamente a sus piernas. Leí notas aquí mismo que decían que requieren entre 3 y 5 pañales por día, yo me arriesgue y solo compré un paquete para unas vacaciones de 5 días y hasta me sobraron, en mi caso mi hija solo usamos la mitad del paquete, ya que si estamos en la alberca y era cuando los usaba, al salir le colocaba los regulares. Eso es digamos algo a considerar ya que asistíamos a las albercas o mar 1 vez al día o máximo 2 así que por eso no necesite tantos como las notas decían, porque repito no tienen la misma absorbencia que uno regular.
